alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 8:54AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Henry, Van Buren, southwestern Jefferson, western Lee, Scotland and western Clark Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 853 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bloomfield to 8 miles south of Downing. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kahoka, Memphis, Keosauqua, Birmingham, Milton, Bonaparte, Stockport, Wyaconda, Cantril, Rutledge, Luray, South Gorin, Granger, Douds, Bentonsport/Vernon, Leando, Greensburg, Crawford, Farmington and Arbela. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
